snippet: Mary Jo White, chairwoman of the S.E.C., said the agency was considering whether to update its liquidity standards for mutual funds.
abstract: Mary Jo White, chairwoman of the S.E.C., said the agency was considering whether to update its liquidity standards for mutual funds.
lead_paragraph: Mutual funds are intended to be mom-and-pop financial products whose investments can be sold off quickly. The funds were never meant to pile into markets where trades take weeks to complete.

headline.main: Mutual Fund Industry May Face New Rules
